intro: [WRONG START] Astellia trinervia, commonly known as the New Zealand flax, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its upright, grass-like appearance with narrow, strap-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant white or greenish-white flowers in clusters during the spring and summer months. It is often found in coastal and wetland habitats, thriving in moist, well-drained soils. Astelia trinervia is valued for its ornamental appeal and historical use in traditional Māori crafts.
